intro: Vandenboschia frappieri, commonly known as the Cape fynbos shrub, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of the Western Cape region. Vandenboschia frappieri is often found in coastal and mountainous areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
